description: The three-week-old male is settling in at Graves Park in Sheffield.
title: Graves Park llama drama as name sought for new arrival
title_page: Graves Park llama drama as name sought for new arrival - BBC News
maintext:
A Sheffield animal farm is inviting the public to name its latest arrival - a baby llama.
The three-week-old male was born at Graves Park at the end of January, and will join a herd of more than 20 llamas, including his two siblings, Lettuce and Humus.
The farm said it would choose his name from comments on a post on its Facebook page.
Head stockperson Jack Tankard said they were looking for something "full of life as he loves to bounce around".
